events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of May 1st involving their sedan and another vehicle at the downtown intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the vehicle collision reported, confirming the incident involves car damage.
An auto claims agent has been assigned to the case and reached out to the insured to discuss next steps and document collection.
The claim was formally acknowledged by the insurance company, assuring the insured that their case is being handled promptly.
The agent requested additional documents including the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and a copy of the insured’s driver’s license.
The insured submitted all requested documents including detailed pictures of the damaged car and the official police collision report.
A formal investigation into the auto accident claim has commenced, reviewing submitted documents and contacting involved third parties.
The investigation concluded with findings supporting the insured’s account of the collision and verification of the damage assessments.
The insurance company proposed a settlement offer to cover repair costs of the vehicle up to the policy limits.
The insured provided positive feedback appreciating the prompt and clear handling of their auto accident claim.
The claim was officially approved, authorizing payment to the repair shop to proceed with vehicle restoration.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued directly to the authorized repair facility on behalf of the insured.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation that vehicle repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All records and documents related to the auto accident claim were archived in accordance with company policy for future reference.
